SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Interface HTTPResponseState

public interface HTTPResponseState
State interface for sending an HTTP response.

This interface is provided to HTTPRequestHandler callbacks and allows the handler to send the response. Methods should be called in order: 

 headers()              // required, includes :status
 headers()              // continuation headers (if needed)
 startResponseBody()    // if response has a body
 responseBodyContent()  // zero or more times
 endResponseBody()      // if body was started
 headers()              // trailer headers (optional)
 complete()             // required

Response Patterns

Simple response with body: 


 Headers response = new Headers();
 response.add(":status", "200");
 response.add("content-type", "application/json");
 state.headers(response);
 state.startResponseBody();
 state.responseBodyContent(ByteBuffer.wrap(jsonBytes));
 state.endResponseBody();
 state.complete();

Response without body (204, 304, redirects): 


 Headers response = new Headers();
 response.add(":status", "204");
 state.headers(response);
 state.complete();

Streaming response: 


 Headers response = new Headers();
 response.add(":status", "200");
 response.add("content-type", "text/event-stream");
 state.headers(response);
 state.startResponseBody();
 // Send chunks as data becomes available
 state.responseBodyContent(chunk1);
 state.responseBodyContent(chunk2);
 // ... more chunks ...
 state.endResponseBody();
 state.complete();

Response with trailer headers: 


 Headers response = new Headers();
 response.add(":status", "200");
 state.headers(response);
 state.startResponseBody();
 state.responseBodyContent(data);
 state.endResponseBody();
 Headers trailers = new Headers();
 trailers.add("x-checksum", checksum);
 state.headers(trailers);  // trailers (after endResponseBody)
 state.complete();

HTTP/2 Server Push

For HTTP/2 connections, pushPromise(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.Headers) can be used to initiate server push. The pushed request will be processed through the normal factory/handler mechanism.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getConnectionInfo

      ConnectionInfo getConnectionInfo()
      Returns connection information (addresses, etc.).
      Returns:
      the connection info

    • getTLSInfo

      TLSInfo getTLSInfo()
      Returns TLS information, or null if the connection is not secure.
      Returns:
      TLS info, or null

    • getVersion

      HTTPVersion getVersion()
      Returns the HTTP version being used for this request/response.
      Returns:
      the HTTP version

    • getScheme

      String getScheme()
      Returns the URL scheme ("http" or "https").
      Returns:
      the scheme

    • getPrincipal

      Principal getPrincipal()
      Returns the authenticated principal, or null if not authenticated.

      This is only populated if the server's Realm performed authentication. If no Realm is configured on the server, authentication is the handler's responsibility.

      Returns:
      the authenticated principal, or null

    • headers

      void headers(Headers headers)
      Sends response headers.

      For the initial response headers, must include the :status pseudo-header with the HTTP status code. Can be called multiple times:

      • Before startResponseBody() - response headers
      • After endResponseBody() - trailer headers

      Headers are buffered until the next event determines how to send them:

      • startResponseBody() - flush as HEADERS frame
      • complete() - flush as HEADERS frame with END_STREAM
      Parameters:
      headers - the headers to send

    • startResponseBody

      void startResponseBody()
      Signals the start of the response body.

      Must be called before responseBodyContent(java.nio.ByteBuffer) if the response has a body. Triggers flushing of buffered headers.

    • responseBodyContent

      void responseBodyContent(ByteBuffer data)
      Sends response body data.

      Can be called multiple times for streaming responses. The buffer contents are sent; the buffer itself is not retained after this call.

      Parameters:
      data - the body data to send

    • endResponseBody

      void endResponseBody()
      Signals the end of the response body.

      Must be called after all responseBodyContent(java.nio.ByteBuffer) calls. After this, headers(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.Headers) calls are interpreted as trailer headers.

    • complete

      void complete()
      Completes the response.

      This must be called to signal the end of the response. For HTTP/2, this sends the END_STREAM flag. For HTTP/1.1 with chunked encoding, this sends the final chunk marker.

      Behaviour depends on buffered state:

      • If headers buffered (no body or trailers pending): flush with END_STREAM
      • If no headers buffered: send empty frame with END_STREAM

    • pushPromise

      boolean pushPromise(Headers headers)
      Initiates an HTTP/2 server push.

      The headers must include the pseudo-headers for the promised request: :method, :path, :scheme, :authority.

      The pushed request will be processed through the normal HTTPRequestHandlerFactory mechanism, creating a new handler for the pushed stream.

      For HTTP/1.x connections, this method returns false and has no effect.

      Parameters:
      headers - the headers for the promised request
      Returns:
      true if the push was initiated, false if not supported or disabled by the client

    • upgradeToWebSocket

      void upgradeToWebSocket(String subprotocol, WebSocketEventHandler handler)
      Upgrades this HTTP connection to WebSocket protocol.

      This method validates the request, sends the 101 Switching Protocols response, and switches the connection to WebSocket mode. Once complete, the handler's WebSocketEventHandler.opened(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.WebSocketSession) method is called.

      Example usage: 

      
 public void headers(Headers headers, HTTPResponseState state) {
     if (WebSocketHandshake.isValidWebSocketUpgrade(headers)) {
         String protocol = headers.getValue("Sec-WebSocket-Protocol");
         state.upgradeToWebSocket(protocol, new DefaultWebSocketEventHandler() {
             private WebSocketSession session;
             
             public void opened(WebSocketSession session) {
                 this.session = session;
             }
             
             public void textMessageReceived(String message) {
                 session.sendText("Echo: " + message);
             }
         });
     }
 }
      Parameters:
      subprotocol - optional negotiated subprotocol (may be null)
      handler - receives WebSocket lifecycle events
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if not a valid WebSocket upgrade request or if the response has already started

    • cancel

      void cancel()
      Cancels the stream.

      For HTTP/2, this sends an RST_STREAM frame. For HTTP/1.x, this closes the connection.

      Use this for error conditions where the normal response flow cannot be completed.
